discussion.p:
This result isn't guaranteed, it depends whether the implementation interprets "//host" as a root-name or as a root-directory (with a redundant directory-separator) followed by the filename "host".
The example should make it clear that this interpretation is allowed.

blockquote.p: This wording is relative to N4727.

blockquote.pre: path("/foo/bar.txt").filename(); // yields "bar.txt" path("/foo/bar").filename(); // yields "bar" path("/foo/bar/").filename(); // yields "" path("/").filename(); // yields "" path("//host").filename(); // yields "" or "host" path(".").filename(); // yields "." path("..").filename(); // yields ".."
